sources.title: The Perfect Clue
sources.description: A spoiled rich girl runs away from home when her father announces that he is going to marry a lady that the girl does not like. She gets involved with an ex-con and together they are implicated in a murder which they must solve to prevent going to prison . . . all they need to solve the murder is a clue . . . maybe the perfect clue!

sources.title: The Perfect Clue (1935) ROMANCE
sources.description:
Stars: David Manners, Richard 'Skeets' Gallagher, Dorothy Libaire
Director: Robert G. Vignola

Mona Stewart, madcap, spoiled daughter of a wealthy man, becomes upset when she learns that her father is engaged to a woman she hates. She runs away, via various modes of transportation, and hires an ex-con, David Mannering, to drive her around as she eludes the all-out search conducted by her father and her fiancée, Ronnie Van Zandt. A romance is blossoming until her chauffeur is arrested for the murder of a crime-syndicate boss.

metadata.Plot: Mona Stewart, madcap, spoiled daughter of a wealthy man, becomes upset when she learns that her father is engaged to a woman she hates. A romance is blossoming until her chauffeur is arrested for the murder of a crime-syndicate boss.
metadata.Writer: Lolita Ann Westman, Albert DeMond, Donald H. Brown
metadata.Actors: David Manners, Richard 'Skeets' Gallagher, Dorothy Libaire
